Thieves hit two bike races over the weekend, prompting a withdrawal of two teams before their respective final stages.

Basque team Euskaltel-Euskadi were forced to abandon before Stage 5 of the Tour of Slovenia after their team van, which contained all their Orbea bikes, was stolen overnight. Baloise-Trek Lions, who were racing in the Baloise Belgium Tour, also had their bikes stolen before the final day, a 194.8km stage in Brussels.

4. Tour of Britain returns to Caerphilly

Stage 8 of the Tour of Britain will finish on Caerphilly Mountain, a 1.4km climb with an average gradient on 10.1%, on 10th September 2023. It last featured in the 2013 edition of the race where Irish sprinter Sam Bennett (Bora-Hansgrohe) claimed the first victory of his professional career for An Post-Chain Reaction. How time flies.
